title: How to Deactivate or Completely Delete Your Facebook Messenger Account

steps.title: Open the Facebook app or website.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app or website. If you’re not already signed in to your Facebook account, sign in now. You must deactivate your Facebook account before you can deactivate Messenger. [1] X Research source While you can deactivate your Facebook account on either a computer or in the mobile app, you can only deactivate Messenger in the Messenger app.

steps.title: Tap the Menu button.
steps.content: Tap the Menu button. Depending on whether you’re using iOS or Android, it will be at the bottom or top of the screen. If you’re on the desktop website, click your profile picture at the top-right corner of Facebook. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Select Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Select Settings & privacy . You’ll need to scroll down to find it. On the website, you’ll see this option near the top of the menu, below your list of profiles.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This is the first option in the Settings & privacy menu.

steps.title: Select See more in Accounts Center.
steps.content: Select See more in Accounts Center . It’s at the top of the menu. On the website, click the Accounts Center box on the upper left side of the screen.

steps.title: Select Personal details.
steps.content: Select Personal details . It’s under the Account settings header.

steps.title: Tap Account ownership and control.
steps.content: Tap Account ownership and control . It’s the last option in the Personal details menu.

steps.title: Choose Deactivation or deletion.
steps.content: Choose Deactivation or deletion . A new menu will open.

steps.title: Select your Facebook account.
steps.content: Select your Facebook account. If you have multiple connected Meta accounts, choose the Facebook account associated with the Messenger account you want to deactivate.

steps.title: Choose “Deactivate account”.
steps.content: Choose “Deactivate account”. You’ll see an option to deactivate or delete your account. Tap the radio button next to “Deactivate account,” then tap Continue . Follow the prompts to finish the deactivation process. If you want to reactivate your account, just log back in. Remember that this is just the first part of the process. If you deactivate your Facebook account without separately deactivating or deleting Messenger, your Messenger account will continue to work as a DEMA (“Deactivated Except Messenger Account”). [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open Facebook Messenger.
steps.content: Open Facebook Messenger. It’s the multi-colored chat bubble icon with a white lightning bolt inside. You’ll usually find it on the home screen or in the app drawer (Android) or App Library (iOS). While you can deactivate your Facebook account on your computer or using the mobile app, you can only deactivate Messenger using the Messenger app. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the ☰ icon.
steps.content: Tap the ☰ icon. This will open a pop-out menu.

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . This is at the top of the menu, next to your profile picture.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Accounts Center.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Accounts Center . It’s at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Select Personal Details.
steps.content: Select Personal Details . This is below the Account settings header.

steps.title: Tap Account ownership and control.
steps.content: Tap Account ownership and control . It’s the last option on the menu.

steps.title: Select Deactivation or deletion.
steps.content: Select Deactivation or deletion .

steps.title: Tap Continue to Facebook account deactivation and deletion.
steps.content: Tap Continue to Facebook account deactivation and deletion .

steps.title: Select Continue to account deactivation.
steps.content: Select Continue to account deactivation .

steps.title: Enter your password and tap Continue.
steps.content: Enter your password and tap Continue . Follow the prompts to confirm your choice. You can always reactivate Messenger by logging back in with your username and password.

steps.title: Delete your Facebook account.
steps.content: Delete your Facebook account. If you prefer to delete your account completely, choose the “Delete account” option in the Facebook app or on the website. Unlike deactivating, this is permanent—you won’t be able to retrieve the account or any of its contents after you delete it! Deleting your Facebook account will also delete your Messenger account. [4] X Research source To delete your account: In the Facebook app or on the website, go to Menu > Settings & privacy > Settings > Accounts Center > Personal details > Account ownership and control > Deactivation or deletion and select your account. Tap the radio button next to Delete account , then tap Continue and follow the prompts to confirm the deletion.

steps.title: Delete Messenger from the app if you have a DEMA.
steps.content: Delete Messenger from the app if you have a DEMA. A DEMA is a “Deactivated Except for Messenger” account. If you’ve deactivated your Facebook account but now want to delete Messenger completely, you can do so from the Messenger app. This process will also delete the deactivated Facebook account associated with your Messenger account. [5] X Research source In Messenger, tap ☰ > > Accounts Center > Personal details > Account ownership and control . Select Deactivation or deletion and choose the account you want to delete. Tap Delete Account > Continue .
